synthesis_conditions.temperature: 110 K for crystallographic analysis; Room temperature for synthesis
chemicals_used: [Cu(CH3CN)4]ClO4 (45 mg for initial synthesis; 22 mg for analysis sample)
synthesis_conditions.washing_method: Transferred directly from solution to oil
synthesis_conditions.drying_method: Cooled to 110 K for crystallographic analysis

additional_steps.details: A buffer zone of chloroform was layered on top of a solution of tpt in 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethane, and then a solution of [Cu(CH3CN)4]ClO4 in acetonitrile was layered on top of that.
For the sample used for analysis, acetonitrile was partially replaced by methanol, and the proportion of copper was reduced.

synthesis_conditions.temperature: 0 C to 45 C for reduction; 115 C for final step

solvents.name: EtOH
solvents.amount: Not specified for reduction; 60% in EtOH for final step

synthesis_conditions.yield: 80% for initial step; 68% combined yield for oxidation and conversion to lactone; 94% combined yield for reduction and final step

additional_steps.details: 7 reacted with the potassium enolate of 6 in DMSO to afford Michael adduct 8.
8 was oxidized with tBuOOH in AcOH in the presence of SeO2 to give pyridone 9.
9 was converted into lactone 10 under acidic conditions.
Lactone 10 was reduced to diol 11 using a modified Luche protocol.
Diol 11 was heated in 60% ethanolic H2SO4 to yield (+)-Camptothecin.
